content.name: alert
content.description:
Information about alerts generated by the storage system.

Alerts are usually events that require attention from the system administrator. Most, although not all, alerts indicate that there is a problem with the storage system. For example, you might receive an alert telling you that a drive has faulted, or that the storage system is running out of space.

For information about configuring alerts, see the Help topics for the alertConfig and AlertConfigSNMPTarget resource types.

Some of the user-visible attributes in this object should be changed to eng-only. @engdocs Holds a single AlertEvent info like Component id, Severity, Resolution ID, Description ID. As of now CLI does not use the Alert Indication. But going forward CLI can query the Alerts in the System instead of the Alert History. This object shows up in the GUI through BAM indication. The IndicationManager native provider processes any CIM_AlertIndication and converts them to BAM_Indication. We need to create an entirely new EMC_UIS_AlertEvent class in the new UIS OSLS provider - UIS_AlertServices which will send create indications to IndicationManager, which in turn will listen to CIM_CreateIndication instead of CIM_AlertIndication. External API can list the EMC_UIS_AlertEvent instances to get the list of Alerts in the system and can listen for CIM_InstCreation for EMC_UIS_AlertEvent for new Alerts generated. In KH we are planning to change native provider to query EMC_UIS_AlertEvents instead of EMC_AlertHistoryEntry objects to generate the list of Alerts in the system.

attributes.name: instanceId
attributes.description: Internal identifier of the alert instance.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the alert instance.

attributes.name: component
attributes.description: System component that caused the alert. This field can be empty in cases where  the alert is not specific to any component. For example, this field will be  empty for log messages that become alerts without associated health state  changes.    @engdocs  We did not propagate the ComponentID with alert to the GUI before. This is  added as a new attribute for the the alert object in KH.

attributes.name: resolutionId
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the help topic for the alert.

attributes.name: timestamp
attributes.description: Date and time when the alert event occurred, in Greenwich Mean Time (GMT)

attributes.name: descriptionId
attributes.description: Description identifier for the alert in the message catalog. This identifier  is used to identify a description of the alert condition.

attributes.name: catalogId
attributes.description: Catalog ID by which the alert message can be looked up.    <Note>  TBD: New in KH  </Note>

attributes.name: isAcknowledged
attributes.description: Indicates whether the alert is acknowledged.

attributes.name: resolution
attributes.description: URI that points to a Help topic containing resolution information for the  alert.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Localized description of the alert condition.

attributes.name: arguments
attributes.description: List of arguments used with the messageId to construct the alert message.

attributes.name: messageId
attributes.description: Message identifier for the alert in the message catalog. This identifier is  used for localization purposes.
